text: Sure its way overpriced.  Sure the pickings are slim.  But if you want a quick decent sized breakfast its the only way to go in terminal D.

great diner fare with a remarkable tuna melt with whole albacore chunks. The unkempt and grease-on-all-surfaces nature of this spot is a considerable turn-off... if they would bus and wipe down the tables and condiments and napkin holders you wouldn't need to eat as if you were in a grease mine field. the food is quite good if heavy, but that shouldn't be a surprise!
It takes a long time to get your food. Burgers are so so. If you like 50's sock hop music then this place is for you.
Best place to lose weight from diarrhea. Make sure you have a 30 min before boarding. I think it's the Cajun fries because my toilet looked like the Red Sea.
Really too expensive for a fast food !!  The burger was ok and deco is nice but we paid over 30 usd for a 2 people.. It s too much
Quality wasn't very good, bread was soggy and full of floursecond bad experience. Will not go back
Chinese chicken salad just bad!  Soggy iceberg lettuce.  Water was the best part of my meal at Ruby Dinette.

Ten Dollars for a muffin sandwich? I was expecting some neat version of the popular breakfast staple, but no... size of an egg mcmuffin, but for TEN dollars. Add another  $5.00 for cold potatoes and you have the perfect start for our 3 hour flight. Thanks for nothing!

This place sucks - and isnt worth any stars! 1 mini cheeseburger withoutfries or anything to drink for 12??! They must be kidding!!! Hamburger is terrible also, they should provide puke bags with their food.

I stopped by here to grab some food to eat on the plane (5:11 flight home). I ordered a vanilla shake and a BLT.

Note that service is not fast--this is not a place you visit if you're hurrying to grab food before your flight. They were training a new guy, too, and there was some confusion about another customer's order.

Anyway, the shake was marvelous--real ice cream. I ate the sandwich on the plane and enjoyed it a lot--a big BLT with avocado on parmesan sourdough. Wonderful! My only minor gripes were the bulky plastic to-go container (hard to deal with on a plane) and that the sandwich wasn't pre-cut, although it probably held together better that way while being manhandled through the airport and into the seat pocket.

This place SUCKS.  I don't recommend it to anyone.  I was with 4 people and they got ALL of our orders wrong.  When we asked them to correct it, they said NO, had an attitude and walked away.  If we had more time or energy I would have cussed out the management in this place and demanded free food.  Never go there.

I can't believe anyone thinks these burgers are decent.  I ate 3 bites, literally got nauseous at the thought of eating another bite, then left to get a sub.  At the best this is grade D, unseasoned beef with an off taste to it.  I would have been better off at Burger King!

Well I got the bread bowl.  it was semi ok chowder in a bread bowl... came with a fork. Guess that foreshadowing for that the chower will be be thick enough to eat with a fork. ... but it was wrong.  It wasn't bad tho

Chili Cheese Fries! I had em before and I wants them again.

I think I let out a little scream when I saw this place with my girlfriends. Not sure if they've been here before since music filled my head as I thought about those chili cheese fries. They are goodness on a plate. The fries are nicely done and the chili... the chili isn't ground beef slopped on my fries, it's shreds of lightly spiced tomato-y beef dousing my fries. I wish we had one in my city... but I guess it will have to stay an airport treat.

The staff is really nice. Our busser was so cute... so happy...
Dry and tasteless hamburger.  So bad I only ate part of it.  Chocolate shake was good but couldn't make up for the burger.

AVOID!!!! 25 mn to be served. We are supposed to be in a fast food in an airport where people are in a hurry. The buyer, because yes for 12$ you have just a burger, no fries or drink, came with cold, still frozen bread! Terrible

I waited 40 minutes for my burger.  It was fair at best.  But, what do you expect from a crowded airport (Las Vegas) burger joint?  If the bun was not a fall apart piece of detritus, it would be better than the average BK burger.  40 minutes?  Unacceptable.

I was not only surprised to learn that these places are still around (there was one in San Diego when I was growing up but has been closed for many many years!) but that they also have a veggie burger! I wish that there were more vegetarian options, but hey, I'll take what I can get! 

It was ok, nothing spectacular. Im sure they didnt make the patty themselves, so it can only be so good if youre paying a restaurant to warm up a frozen store bought patty and dress it with their own items.

My friend got some big breakfast sandwich and was thoroughly disgusted. Not sure why, but I made a joke about actual 50s food being really bad for you and having things like cigarettes in the food its self, which livened the conversation. Im guessing that if you're going to go to a burger joint, get the one thing that they are supposed to be good at.

Eh. Nothing special. I was hungover and waiting for my flight so was excited to see a burger joint, but was overall disappointed.

I got a Ruby Cheeseburger with cheddar cheese, fries, and a small drink. It came out to $15 which is ridiculous even for an airport.

The burger itself was average tasting as were the fries. It was extremely greasy, however, to the point where I took my first bite and a gallon of grease hit my shorts (which are now ruined).  Everyone who didn't order the burger (which were two people) had to wait 15 minutes for their order. It was a chicken sandwich and a turkey sandwich so can't see why this would take that much longer.

Also, soda refills were $0.79. If you require people to get their own soda from the soda fountain you should make the refills free. 

Not your worst option, but you're better off going to Chili's Too which is a one minute walk down.
Food was bland. They forgot my order. Very disappointing.

Awful, disrespectful, slow service. Ordered a Ruby burger and a bottle of water. After waiting for it to be brought to me for 25 minutes, I checked with cashier in the status. They had neglected to put the order in, and didn't seem to particularly care about that. In fact, they acted as if I had bothered them. I demanded and received my money back and I won't go here again. Lots of other alternatives in this terminal. Go there if you enjoy lousy service from rude peopl

We just arrived in Vegas and we were starving. Ruby's appeared to be a cool little 50's diner, and a hearty meal is what we had in mind. No such luck.

The Sandwiches and Burgers do not come with fries, but that doesn't matter, I was told, because lunch won't be served for 10 more minutes. No chance of ordering it now. Boy, was that lucky! Saved me from a bad meal rip-off. My friend got what someone might call "French Toast." He described it more as soggy toast... and the bacon, yuck. I'm not sure I'd ever pass up bacon... until now.

If you must eat breakfast here, get the country potatoes. They have no flavor, but at least there isn't much that can go wrong.

I should've known better than to think you could get even halfway decent food in an airport.

Looks like a vintage diner. I ordered a sour dough parmesan grilled cheese.  It was supposed to come on sour dough bread but came on texas toast. It was 1 sliced processed American cheese and 1 slice processed swiss cheese. The cheeses were like the ones that come in an individual plastic wrapper. Ordered a basket of fries but those didn't come out. They gave ma a half basket instead.  I brought it to their attention and they gave me my full basket. The fries are the really skinny ones. The grilled cheese taste like buttered bread and that's it. No cheese taste at all. While I was there forcing myself to eat this less than desirable food. I heard some yelling. It was a lady yelling at a cook because he called her mama or something like that. I will definitely not be back.
This place is great.... the food is amazing, good selection of on tap beer, also for 5 dollars more, a shot of your choice... i highly recommend the Parmesan sourdough grilled cheese... delicious....
I just love this place - specifically the Mushroom Swiss Burger - my standard place to go when leaving Vegas

Awesome egg sandwich is the name... was there any awesome components to this dish???  The size of the dish for the price was pretty awesome.  The sandwich was not bad, not great.  I like that this place was open when we got to the airport so early in the morn.  That is one thing that stinks when you take a real early flight or a real late flight is not having any shops or food places open.  Having this place open after a night of gambling was a big plus for me.  Were I in this airport again and looking for a meal, would I come here again?? Maybe, I would probably see if something else was open, but for an airport, the food was not too bad.

We came for breakfast, which took over 50 minutes to recieve. We were told it was due to a computer glitch, which sounded like a made up excuse. About 40 minutes into the 50 minute wait, we were told it would be rushed to us, 10 minutes later still no food. The food was simple, french toast and what amounted to an egg mcmuffin and potatoes, but took almost an hour to reach our table! They comped my friends bailey's from her Irish coffee, but still charged us $3.49 for 1 cup of coffee and full price for the meal! Never going back and would not recommend people looking to grab a meal before a flight.

Needed a quick bite and their food looked delicious while walking by the door. Decided to order a RubyChick- a chicken sandwich, it tasted disgusting! The fries were stale, cold and had almost no flavor. The bun was crumbly, which is not a good word to use for a bun. The cashier was unfriendly and the food took forever! My next visit to McCarren Airport will not consist of Rubys Diner!

You're probably just better off getting a bag of Doritos, some jerkey, and a  Coke at the newspaper stand.  To say this place wasn't worth it is an understatement.

I mean it's not terrible, but it's really kind of sad and it's not gonna make your flight any better.  Save your money and your time.  Go buy a magazine and some snacks and just accept your fate, you're in an American airport and that's only one step above jail.

I had time on my hands and was really looking forward to a good breakfast.  I ordered the egg sandwich and found a seat.  Nice enough place, old diner atmosphere.  Unfortunately, the sandwich was less than satisfactory.  The egg, bacon and cheese had obviously been premade as they were cold (the cheese had not even melted a bit).  The muffin had gone through about 1/2 a toaster cycle and was warm but not toasted.  I would have been much better off at burger king (near gate D4) or the other place that was near BK.  Not my worst meal but I've experienced (much) better.

I got trapped at the airport for 18 hours due to delays, etc. One of the only perks I got was a $16 food credit. Not knowing where to go or how much time I had, I walked into Ruby's and ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and drink. All this was over $16, which is nuts, but I only had to pay $1.60 out of pocket, so who am I to complain. 

It was a lot of food and pretty decent for an airport. It also came out fairly quickly.

When you tell someone that it is going to take 15-20 minutes to prepare their order, especially due to the grilled chicken I expect the chicken to look like it spend some time on the grill. It was late and we were getting ready to board a red-eye back to NJ. I think this is why my wife only ate a portion of it before throwing the rest away. I decided to go with a cheeseburger, it wasn't bad, but I probably should have stuck with plan A, and grabbed some In and Out Burger before I arrived at the airport. If you have time make the trip to another gate, or another terminal. 

I decided to grab a drink while I waited for my order. FYI, the bar and the restaurant are considered separate eateries.

This turned out to be a good choice for breakfast. It is located in the McCarren Airport in Las Vegas. 

It's a solid three stars. I almost gave it an email xtra star just for the kool sign they have with a plane and the propeller that spins. Kool sigh and actually one of the reasons we picked the place. 

This restaurant really borders on four stars but I could quite get there. This place has a whole list of just "ok's" which isn't necessarily a bad thing at all. The restaurant served its purpose. Have us an ok meal, with ok service, an ok price, ok surroundings. It was just ok. More of a good ok instead of a bad ok. There just wasn't anything to rise it above three stars. (the sign is super kool though.)

The place was pretty crowded, and was not dirty but not real clean either it was ok clean. I didn't see anyone cleaning. But I have to admit it was crowded enough keeping it properly would be a challenge for sure. 

There isn't a ton of choices for breakfast in the immediate area and this surely is a step above places like Burger King and places like that. 

This place is not a bad choice if you want a decent meal and need it quickly.

Total ripoff.  Wayyyy overpriced!  Costs over $15.00 for a breakfast sandwich and a small orange juice.  I know it's the Vegas airport but even so this is price gouging at it's finest. Staff was somewhat nice so I gave them 2 stars instead of one.  Save your money and eat somewhere else...

Ordered a peanut butter cup milkshake. It had no cups. I stirred it to see if they were hiding at the bottom. Couldn't find them. Walked up to counter before taking a bite of the shake and asked if they forgot to put the cups in or if perhaps I should stir more to find them? They said "there aren't supposed to be PB cups. It's just a flavor." Hmm. False advertising? Menu clearly identifies a "Peanut Butter Cup" shake.

I went to Ruby's for breakfast as it was one of the few sit-down places and I had some time to kill. I've been to other Ruby's locations before, so I wasn't terribly concerned and didn't check Yelp! first. [big mistake]

I ordered the Cinnamon Roll French toast with a side of bacon (only $2 more! she said) and sat down to wait for food. 
Lucky for me I had some time to kill.... it took 45 minutes to bring me the french toast, and another 10 to bring me the bacon they totally forgot about when running the food. The bacon was undercooked enough that I didn't eat it. 

Granted, they were in the middle of a rush, but 30+min ticket times and undercooked food suck by any standard. 

It was pretty clear by the order some of my fellow patrons food came out that they are probably either very cramped for flattop space (grill), or their cook/expo doesn't know how to prioritize. 

I can't speak for their lunch, but based on the other reviews here I'd say save yourself the headache and go elsewhere. 

At least for breakfast go next-door to the Starbucks, like I should have done.

Horrible customer service at 11pm!!!  On top of it...the cooks were screaming and cussing at each while cooking our meal.  Then while we were eating...the cooks started asking the cashier about her pregnancy.   Just avoid this place at all cost!
Honestly not that bad considering what the other choices were at the airport.  Staff was friendly and efficient and the food came out hot and freshly made.

For the price, the avocado burger was not worth it. It tasted like the avocado was almost at the verge of going bad. The meat in the burger was OK. The milkshake was yummy though. A bit runny like any regular ol milkshake I could get at a fast-food joint. But it was pretty good. The wait was pretty long. Probably 15 min or so. They were backed up, the guy behind the counter said. Now, they have a gumball machine with 1 cent gum balls. I bought 3. Imagine my surprise when the machine would only take pennies. I'd go back for a quick bite, but it's nothing to brag about.

Ruby's Diner is one of my favorite burger joints. Sadly this is the only location in Las Vegas. It's located in the McCarran International Airport. They have a great "classic" burger. I also like there breakfast.

Good food. Order was average time (10 minutes), when the food was ready they brought it to the table and said they were out of something we ordered ($6.50 item) and then said we could substitute. We asked for an item that was $3.50 and they tried to tell us we would only get $1.00 back. We decided to opt for a big bottle of water  just so we wouldn't have to deal with arguing anymore.

Stopped by to get the boy a quick bite before he flew out of town.  He wanted a burger and so I got him just a plain hamburger combo with a drink.  It came to about $15 bucks.  Ouch!  I understand that it probably costs a lot to lease from the airport but still!  The plain jane burger was just that....plain.  The restaurant does off nice seating to watch the airplanes take off and land. We did refill my boy's drink several times and as per the previous reviews, we did not have to pay for them.  Eat before you go to the airport.
So grossed out by this restaurant. Extremely pricey and disgusting when you walk in. CLEAN your restaurant or hire new staff.

Poor service, poor food quality. Totally disappointed by this place. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and I laid an extra $5 for extra chicken... besides being tasteless also the quantity was disappinting.

I was going to say the place is expensive because it is in the airport but it is actually no more expensive than any tourist place in Las Vegas. $30 for 2 breakfasts and a bottle if water.  

845 am on the 4th of July and our food came out very promptly.

We had the Ruby Muffin Combos. The sandwich was hot and tasty, and the potatoes were plentiful. Would eat here again.

Located in Terminal D next to Starbucks and Cinnabon, this is the terminal that will take you OHare, Miami or in my case, JFK. 

The food is expensive and greasy. If you chose to come here, I like that they have a soda machine for multiple refills. If you need to kill time, and really like soda, you can self serve refills. 

The food will run toy about ~$8 sandwich, ~$5 for fries. You will get a better sandwich anywhere but it's the airport so what do you expect?

Ruby's at the D gates is a very solid food choice.  The burgers are thick and well made, fries were hot, people friendly and the prices were reasonable.

I left satisfied and full,  thumbs up!

Before catching my flight out my group decided to get a bite to eat here. With it being in eye sight of the escalator and has the word diner in it, it seemed like the perfect place to go. Unfortunately, it wasn't.

Service was slowwwwwww, especially for a place that was damn near empty. 

Milkshakes came out quick. Chicken sandwich was definitely frozen before preparation and salad looked like it was a day away from spoiling.

Overall I could've went without.

They do have a "To Go" side of the diner, maybe we should've considered.

Ruby's Diner inside of Terminal D at Las Vegas Airport was a good selection to grab an early lunch. Grilled cheese, onion rings, BLT with avocado and half order of French fries was way to much food to eat. The Bloody Mary had a large spicy kick, added some water to dim it down. Very good food, priced at airport prices but was worth it. Give this place a chance next time your at Terminal D. Breakfast served until 10 am.

This place was ok, not great. My egg and bacon sandwich was fine. If I was hungry I would eat one again. My friend got the BLT and it looked really good it also had some avocado on it and she said it was great.

Cashier can't use cash register then can't count change back. Cooks disappeared and no one was cooking orders! Took forever to get food. Watched as cashier kept going in the back and kept customers who wanted to order waiting. Order was wrong, but we got a free order of fries so it was in our favor. Hamburger patties were the frozen kind. Wouldn't eat here again.

Hm...the food was fine. The menu is just super limited. They only serve breakfast until 10, so after that, you're stuck with a burger or a sandwich. I enjoyed my sandwich - my husband and I split the turkey club. Since we asked to split, I expected a second plate. We were only given one plate, so that made sharing a bit awkward. 

I know this is vegas, but the prices here were outrageous. $45 for one sandwich and two bloody marys! The space is cute, but for that price, I'd expect some kind of variety in the menu.

1 star for filling, 1 star for quick.  Not much else to recommend about the place.  The breakfast menu is fairly limited, French toast or egg sandwich on roll or English muffing.  The roll I got was stale and the bottom absolutely caked in flour that I had to scrape off using the plastic knife as a putty knife.  

Still, the location is right at the top of the escalator at D terminal, so whether you're heading left or right to your gate, it's convenient.  Quick too. I paid, squeezed through the crowd at the self serve drink fountain, sat and almost immediately had the food brought over to the table... almost before I had time to put the service number in the holder.

The egg was real, plenty of American cheese, and fairly crisp bacon.  I got tired of the stale roll halfway through the sandwich, and used the bottom of the other half as a plate to eat the egg, cheese, and bacon off of.

If you want something quick and filling, this is your place.  I'm not sure what other options there are in the terminal, but next time I'll continue looking before returning to Ruby's.

We found this resturant/ eatery while we were waiting for our flight. 
Not cheap at all. 
Husband and I ordered the egg sandwich, ( english muffin with scrambled-eggs, bacon and cheese) with some potatoes on the side. Bacon was to over cooked. And we shared a small OJ. Order came to over $30. 

If your looking for something fast, and expensive then This is the place to go. But not worth the price.

Terrible food. The fries were soggy and the service was nonexistent. Really? Two burgers and two fries for $39? What the hell. The burger was undercooked and had ton of mayo. While the food was out and people were waiting, the staff was replenishing the forks and knives.  What the hell. 

I will never eat here again. It is on par with garbage. I'm pretty sure I could make better food with my eyes closed and cooking with my feet.

Well, I tried chilis, and BK but they were both closed. At 7pm on a Tuesday.  What's wrong with this airport? 

Anyways, I figured this was pretty much my only chance in this terminal. I ordered a cheeseburger, fries and soda for a mere 14.68.  The food arrived five minutes later (not the long wait others yelpers experienced). 

The burger was large and came loaded with fresh toppings. It was cooked decently, not as overcooked as you'd expect in a airport terminal. The meat patty was pretty big too.  The fries were your typical julienne, and they were hot and crispy. 

Overall, it was a decent burger. It wasn't award winning but it was fine. Of course if BK had been open there would have been no reason for me to go to rubys.  Not a $10 cheeseburger. 

Tip. Although 0.85 for refills seems bad, its actually pretty cheap considering a bottle of soda is $2-3 in the terminal. If you stick around for a while, its worth it.
Burger is dry, veggies are not the freshest.  The fries re bland and it's very expensive for a burger.

Dinner was amazing! The burgers are huge, I had the mushroom swiss burger with a veggie patty. The garnish was crunchy and fresh and the patty was hot. It smelled delicious and it was a nice comfy place to sit and eat. Definitely on the expensive side but it was worthy the hot, solid dinner before leaving town. The service was ok, not openly rude but not very friendly either. At least for the interaction that we had with our cashier. The other employees seemed happy/nice.

While typical of any airport eatery, the prices are high; $7+ for a bowl of soup, but they do offer employees 20% off. I had an order of fried zuchini, which was pretty good. For $5.50 it was a decent serving size and was garnished with parm cheese. Now, who can go wrong with a bit of parm cheese?!

Their fries are super thin, they call them shoestring, but they are not quite that thin. I like my fries thick, so I'm not a fan of the fries. Maybe I'd like them better smothered with chili and cheese, tho ($8).

I really appreciate that they were open later than other places.
First time here.  Excellent burger and fries.  Great onion rings and a decent BLT.   Quick service and great coca cola products!  Some of the best airport food we've had.

Worst breakfast of my life, I waited a solid 20 minutes for an order of French toast, and they kept serving customers ahead of me. Really not up to snuff, even for airport food. My expectations weren't that high and they still failed to meet them. 

My friend also ordered a breakfast burrito who's eggs were raw cheese unmelted and tortilla soggy. We both came to the agreement that to be a staff member of this facility you must be hard to understand and speak to fast. Over all terrible service and food quality.

Ruby's motif is an old fashioned American burger and shakes malt shop joint.   The menu is straight forward with and assortment of burgers, and shakes.

I've heard good things about Ruby's Diner from a few friends and I held fairly high expectations coming in.  I had a cheeseburger and double vanilla shake. The burger was dry and the lettuce was so cold that it actually acted like air conditioning to the meat.  I had asked for no whip cream on my shake, but alas when they made it, it had a large chunk of whip cream on the top.  It was an okay shake, nothing to brag about, nor could I taste what would be referred to as "double vanilla".

Now, keep in mind this Ruby's location is located in the Las Vegas Airport, and Airport chain restaurants are typically a few points below their counterparts in the main city.  I may choose to give Ruby's another chance down the road, but not at this location.
Worst service experience I ever had! Bartender is more worried about what he is watching on tv then taking care of the guests. Very rude, and unpleasant. I would not waist my time at this place.

I'm not sure why so many hate on this place. 

There used to be a location north of Seattle but sadly they shut down after the 'remodel' of Alderwood Mall. Perhaps forced out with the 'new' food court. 

So now this location is the only one that I get to frequent when flying through Vegas (which I seemed to be doing every quarter for work). 

This was one of my 'highlights' of the trip is getting to the airport earlier so that I had time to a) wait in the usually long line and b) enjoy my burger

Yes, the service can take a while (do you like fresh food or food that's been waiting on a grill line?) Also, they make some awesome shakes. I tried a few times but I can never finish one. 

Bring your patience and your cash; the place isn't super cheap for a burger but you're also at an airport. EVERYTHING is on the spendy side.

Pretty poor by Ruby's standards (I used to dine somewhat frequently at the Newport Beach location, and was a big fan). The hamburger was dry and dull, and onion rings were awful. So glad I didn't order a shake. Tables are squeezed together, so if you have carry-on bags with you, you might want to opt to dine elsewhere.

Curious note: there is a placard which has a list of "rules" signed by Ruby, sort of a contract with the customer. At the top, the title reads "To help win the war." What war are they talking about? Is there a dirty little secret burger chain war going on unbeknown to myself and the American public? They couldn't possibly be talking about the "war" on terror...if someone knows, please educate my ignorant self.

I mean, take this place in context. It's in an airport. Which means they can get away with selling bottled water for $3.79 and a forgettable but not unpleasant cheeseburger and fries for $12.19. 

Picture this: it's12:30pm. I  have lots of time before my flight, and I really want a filling breakfast meal because I'm flying back to the East Coast and I haven't had anything to eat yet that day. Ruby's offers something called an "Awesome Egg Sandwich." Awesome! Egg Sandwich! Just what I'm looking for. I wait in the line for maybe 10 minutes, and as soon as I get to the cashier (who I'm pretty sure is wearing a Burger King visor?), I realize that breakfast is only served until 10:30. Uggghhhhh. Guess I'll get a burger.

The woman was really nice while I waffled on what kind of burger I wanted (cheeseburger with swiss), if I wanted fries (yes), and if the mushroom swiss burger was available with a combo (no). I waited for about 7 minutes for my food. Because I had time, this was fine, but I would have felt very anxious if I had been in a hurry. They packed up everything very nicely, including napkins and ketchup packets without my asking. Thanks! 

Then, I ran into my friends who were eating burgers and fries from Burger King. I realized that BK was probably a much more economical option, but when I said that, they said, "No, this cost like $12." So in the choice between a burger meal from a quaint diner and a massive fast food joint, I felt like I had made the right decision.

So the Burger was good, the fries were kind of bland, but what really stood out was the bad service. I was at the airport late and hungry and this was one of the few places still open. I really wouldn't be complaining except for one indian (I think?) working there that wanted to tell us they were closed (even though another male employee had pushed us to come in) and then refused to give me a water cup larger than a shot glass. What was most annoying was that I had asked her 3 times about a larger cup, the last of which times I asked if a manager would allow it. She vehemently insisted that company policy would not allow it, but low and behold as I was walking out with my 3 tiny water cups the manager saw my predicament and offered the largest cup. I would never go back just because I would not want to have to deal with the indian lady ever again.

So very unfortunate that McCarran Airport has such lackluster food options. 

Ruby's has the feel of a Johnny Rockets that has had all of the fun, cleanliness, and spirit beaten out of it. The servers looked tired and completely disinterested. You place your order at the counter and are then given a plastic number card to place on your table for the servers to deliver your food. Sat down at a table that my dining companion said smelled of puke. He was right. We moved.  

Ordered a bacon burger with a side of onion rings. NOTE: they will only cook burgers well done = taste cooked out of burger. Onion rings were the only thing keeping this from being a 1-star review. While greasier than I would have liked, the rings were hot, well-seasoned, and plentiful. For $22, I have to believe there's a better option in terminal 3 (D). The food took much longer (15-20 minutes) to arrive than it should have.

Not sure when I'll be back in Vegas, but I am sure I won't be returning to Ruby's.

I normally don't rave about airport restaurants, but Ruby's Diner is an exception. The cashier misheard my order and I was given the wrong sandwich. I was expecting to be given a hard time about it, but instead they went out of their way to make it right. In fact, I was given a complimentary bottle of water for the wait. I didn't catch their names but the cashier and I assume the manager on duty who were working on 12/20 around 1:40pm were great. Exceptional experience especially for airport fare. The grilled chicken sandwich was also tasty.

I have never heard of this place before, but there was one located in the McCarran Airport.  The theming was very cool - retro 1950's.   We went in there before our return flight home.  I ordered a grilled cheese and it was SO GOOD.  The sandwich itself had parmesan cheese on the outside of the bread and grilled so that the cheese was toasted, melted and delicious. Inside I added a slice of tomato,   It came with fries which were also very very good. 
The prices were reasonable - actually more than reasonable considering, we were in the Airport. 
The service was very efficient and friendly. 
It was my last meal in Vegas and surprisingly more satisfying than some of the ones I had on the strip. 
So many bad reviews on here make me wonder if what I had was a fluke, but my experience was great. We will eat here again.

There's absolutely nothing special about the experience here, whether the lackluster burgers or the kitschy decor that tries to recall diner folklore of yore. The servers are courteous enough, but I'm sad to say that at a place like this, which isn't much of a step up from a self-service fast-food joint, they're also dressed in dated attire and pretty much irrelevant. Sort of like the whole Ruby's concept in itself.

About the only redeeming qualities of this outlet are that there's always room to spread out because it's never crowded here, and that it's centrally located within its terminal.

Turkey club with a side of Cajun fries. Sandwich was dry and didn't have enough bacon. Not even one strip. and fries had too much seasoning. The tables were dirty and the staff were all standing around talking to each other. This was in a Wednesday evening while I was waiting for my flight.

You're in an airport, you're hungry, and you're craving some breakfast food. So where do you go? Well, you can go to etiher Cinnabon and stuff your face sinfully with a cinamon roll, OR you can go to Ruby's Dinette where you can select something that resembles a descent breakfast menu. 

You order at the counter, you're given a number to place on your table and you choose your seating. I ordered the french toast and the service was average, but prompt. 

The french toast was exactly what I would expect airport french toast to look and taste like. 2 flimsy pieces of bread, dipped in batter, pan fried and served with your side plastic syrup. 

I had fond memories of eating decent food at Ruby's Diner, but sadly, no matter how hung over you are, it falls just below expectations...even for an airport Dinette.

While at McCarren Airport in Las Vegas waiting for our flight, we needed a quick bite. Since flights don't serve meals any more...

I ordered their version of a club sandwich. My only complaint was the soft bun they served it on. The turkey breast was fresh, the bacon crisp, there was fresh avocado, lettuce and tomato. It was quite large and I could only eat about 1/2 of it, so we took the rest home with us.

Ruby's is decorated like an old 1950s diner. It's cute. The service is not so good, they aren't very friendly and are terse, but I chalk that up to this being in airport more than anything else. Otherwise, it was okay.

The breakfast burrito was supposed to have eggs, pico de gallo, sour cream and green onions. It didn't come with the sour cream or the green onions. I asked for the items and they gave me plenty. Watch out for your order. Also, food tasted bland and the items were pricey. The decor is nice though, that bumped it up a little."

THIS PLACE NOT ONLY HAS NASTY ASS BURGERS BUT THE SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!  

After i orderded people were waiting for over 40 minutes and there plane was boarding so they started yelling into the kitchen "JUST GIVE ME WHAT U GOT!" PUAHAHHAA  thats when i relized i should of went elsewhere...

I ordered the ruby burger i realized i may have missed ordered cause i realized there was no cheese with this burger, but come on plz put some mayo on my burger and dont over cook  my paddy!  I felt like i was eating a card board burger! SOOO nasty i only ate most of it cause i paid for it and i was hungry.  Fries were fries nothing special....

Wanted to go to burger king originally but the gate was closed to go there!

NEVER GOIN HERE AGAIN!

Not sure why there's some bad reviews... it's a classic diner at an airport, this is absolutely not a fancy or hipster burger joint. It hit every expectation I had. A good, greasy, burger to soak up my 3 days of  binge drinking and gambling in Vegas lol.

It's pay at the counter and they bring you the food kind of place, not quite fast food but it's pretty quick. I always stop in for a burger and fries before heading home. I have never had any issues with the service or the food and it became a regular to do. 

I always do the bacon cheeseburger and change the cheese to pepper jack. This reminds me of a 60's diner.  I always feel better after eating here. The bun is absolutely amazingly soft which also soaks up some of the grease. As I write this it's making me crave another....

$8 for a grilled cheese? Sure, if it was fantastic.  But at Ruby's, the grilled cheese is just okay.  Service is mediocre at best.  I was told twice to go to a different register before someone finally took my order.
Slow service, cold food, bad coffee. There really is no excuse for staff wandering around looking like they're lost while good suits getting cold on the counter.   Stay away.

After several frustrating flight scheduling mishaps, I somehow found myself in Vegas with only about an hour and a half to spare before my next flight, so I went on a search for something to make the night a bit more bearable. 

The sounds of a 60's juke box wafted into the terminal followed closely by the scent of diners from bygone days, so I was intrigued. 

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger (with pepper jack cheese), fries and a strawberry milkshake. The burger was thick, well seasoned and fresh off of the griddle, allowing the cheese to melt just enough to keep the ample bacon slices glued in. The fresh fries were crisp on the outside, soft on the inside (though I had to add salt and pepper, which I rarely do). The star of the show was the authentic, hand dipped milkshake. This wasn't one of those things that comes out of a machine - this was a "you're gonna need a straw AND a spoon" work of art.
Poor quality Hamburger, ok fries.  Service was slow.  I would have rather eat somewhere else.

Cinnamon Roll French Toast.

I was going to drop the Mike and end my review there, but I will keep typing.  That French toast is gooood.  It's a cinnamon roll sliced into three slabs, battered and fried.  So good!  It's all I've gotten there.  It's all I'll continue to get.  You should get it too.

There's not much selection at the airport when you want something that seems at least a little made to order.  Anywayz, I was craving an assortment of food since I hadn't eaten all day, so I went to Ruby's and got a Chicken Cesar and Chili Cheese Fries.  The food took a while since I guess they don't make it til we order it?  But they forgot the onions on my fries!  WTF?!  Other than that, the food was pretty good for airport food.

It was open at 4:45 am!!!!!  Awesome.  We had a super early flight and were nervous that we would not be able to find any place open.  Luckily there was Ruby's.  Yes it was really expensive for two breakfast sandwiches, homefries and drinks but it was worth it. I was happy that we got to sit in a restaurant to pass the time and actually be able to eat decent food.

My two friends and I were just completely disrespected. We sat down to have a drink or two before our flight and even ordered some food from the restaurant. I myself personally asked for a water. Stephen poured a foamed over beer for my friend that leaked all over the bar. I grabbed some extra napkins and cleaned it up myself. He then makes a drink for my other friend which he immediately after fills a glass of water for me and we get an order of Ruby Rings. He puts the ring order in and turns around and looks back to me. Stephen asks if I want anything besides a water. I said not right now. He then quickly replies, "You can't sit at the bar if you don't order something." (Mind you... it's a completely empty bar) My friend replies, "He ordered the rings" to be followed by a quick rebuttal from Stephen as he turns back to the computer and says "So that's how you're going to play it". We asked him to cancel the rings and close us out. None of this makes sense to a couple of guys being in the hospitality industry, one of us being a successful restaurant owner for over 10 years and in the hospitality industry for much longer than that, and myself being a bartender/manager. Stephen clearly doesn't belong in this industry and is a very poor reflection on Ruby's Diner. Especially considering as I sit in the public area of the airport a few tables away he is now out from the bar eating and drinking in front of customers with his manager Cara. I have never been treated so poorly at a restaurant/bar in my life, won't be back to this restaurant, and tell this story to everyone about our experience.

Run of the mill airport food. Not bad but not very good either. The service was kind of crappy but it must suck to work at an airport. heck I don't know. I wouldn't stop here again if I ever have a layover though. 
The food was just ok, like I said..not terrible, but nothing spectacular either...

This little diner here in the terminal offers a couple morning bites that you can get pretty quickly before jumping on the plane. We had the breakfast burrito which was a little on the Bland side and kind of small. We also had the full order of fries with Cajun seasoning which actually is just Old Bay Seasoning I think but never-the-less the fries were nice and crispy and a little bit of spice was a nice touch. The wait was not too bad for the food so if you're in a pinch and starving this is a good place to stop in and get some sustenance before your long flight.

I used to eat here every time I was leaving Vegas.  But, they have increased their pricing SO much and the service just keeps getting worse and worse.  Today,  we stood in "line"  nearly 10 minutes before someone actually acknowledged our presence.  40 dollars for a burger,  grilled cheese,  shared order of fries and 2 drinks.  Absolutely ridiculous for the mediocre quality of food.  There are much better options right across the hall.

Overpriced but what I'm the airport isn't? When I got there there wasn't a line. The cashier was nice enough but couldn't speak English very well. I ordered a cheeseburger, fries and a drink. It came out to a little less then $18. It didn't take too long to get the food out. Presentation wasn't the best but it tasted delicious! I was really surprised how good it tasted. The burger was cooked perfect and the fries were skinny and a little on the crispy side. Overall I'm pretty happy I stopped by.

Not bad. Quick burger before a flight.
Most people are depressed as they leave Vegas which might explain the bad reviews. I don't think this place is that bad and it's not like there are many other options in the terminal anyway.
Food is never good. Staff is rude and not helpful. Very slow as well. I wouldn't eat here.

I really hate airport food, but sometimes you just have to have a full meal there because your next meal won't be for hours. We needed to have a big brunch/lunch so we headed here. I got the BLT-A (avocado BLT) and my husband got the burger. Much to our delight, they were both so good! I would definitely get their BLT-A again! we also ordered a basket of fries (cajun style). They were meh, probably should've just ordered them regular. You order up front, and then take your # and place on table. They will bring you your food. Fast-casual dining :)

This diner is the first restaurant you see as you step off of the escalator so the foot traffic is there.  Maybe I should have checked around more.

Upon entering, it is a cute diner.  You walk up to the "Order Here" area and order your items.  The ordering process is very easy - limited menu.  Then you are given a number and when the order is ready, a food runner will bring it to you.  I had ordered the French Toast. I figure I really can't go wrong.

I was able to obtain a small table against the wall of windows.  You have a great view of the tarmac.  My order was brought to me within 10 minutes.  The French Toast was okay.  It didn't seem like the toast was cooked all the way through.

I would concern another restaurant in the future.

Weak bear selection, but they did have a local on draft. Bartender Steve waits at least 10 minutes to greet customers, doesn't offer the same specials to everyone and leaves the bar a lot. He also tries to pressure customers into upsales and isn't very accommodating. Try a different bar.

Unfortunately the meal here was really horrible. Surly help. No ice in the ice machine. Burger was dry, and the fries were cold. No napkins the napkin holder no catchup in the catchup bottle. You get the drift. Go eat somewhere else when you're in the airport.

Bleh.

Poor quality. Should've just had a cinnabun.

I ordered the 'Awesome Egg Sandwich' Extra Awesome. The cashier chuckled. The food tasted like something out of a cardbard box that had been nuked until hot.

Bring hotsauce and cover everything with it. You'll thank me.

Employees stood around while I'm waiting for my to-go milkshake. Locating inside an airport, isn't it common sense that people are rushing to their flight, especially if it's a to-go order. After waiting for more then 10 mins for my shake, I went over to the kitchen side and asked if my shake was ready. Then they started making it! What the heck? What were they standing around for????

DO NOT waste your time or money on this RIP-OFF spot!  Old, cold fries, crapy frozen burger patty at a Cadillac price!  I would not let this place be the first or last BAD Vegas experience!  I have had better burgers at a gas station heated in a microwave!  I have never felt so screwed by restaurant in my life!  $16.95 for Cheeseburger & Fry, are kidding me!

Barely diner quality food with servers that lack friendliness. This place wouldn't survive if it wasn't at the airport with captive customers. The hash browns are like you are eating chiclets of cardboard. See picture. They do crank out the food fast but it's diner food. It's fast by design. It was clean and not crowded with plenty of tables and counter seats. Keep walking there are better restaurants down the concourse.

This is a quick restaurant with prompt service. You seat yourself and server comes right over. The breakfast menu was very limited , 4 choices. I got the burrito and it was large and very good. Not fancy, pretty basic... But tasty. None of the items come with a side. We ordered the potatoes, they were just boring.

Instead of gagging on CPK fare, I gagged on Ruby's egg muffin instead. At the height of the breakfast hour, I was served a rubbery egg sandwich with coagulated cheese and cold bacon. How dare they charge almost $7 for that crap!

Terrible Experience.
The chicken sandwich was dry and inedible. The employees could care less about there jobs and accidentally overcharged us because she was not paying attention. I had the turkey sandwich which was covered in white flour and then the dust got on my  face and hands. The average price is about ten dollars or so. It's overpriced and disgusting. The ketchup was watery and had a foul taste to it. The fries soggy and burnt. Really? Why serve food to other humans that would not be fit for your own consumption. I wouldn't even give a dog this mess. Avoid this place at all costs!
Poorly managed - don't go if you are at all short on time.  Staff wonder around looking for order numbers and seem unconcerned about all the people waiting.
Had the mushroom burger and Cajun fries.   The buns were cold and cheese barely melted.  The Cajun fries is not worth paying an extra dollar.   Would not come back again.

The chili was fantastic. 
Meaty - not ground beef and not overloaded with beans either.
I got takeout, so I can't say anything about the service.

The food was terribly bland. The fries had zero flavor. I usually don't like salty fries but I think some salt would have helped here. The burger was equally bland. I had to put ketchup and mustard on it to give it some flavor. That didn't help much either. I think I would have been better off eating at the Burger King. Only plus is that it wasn't all that expensive.

No no no no, no no, NO!
It's in an airport, I get that the prices are gonna be a little high. BUT, it's in an airport, where people are generally on a timeline. I don't believe the staff are cognizant of this?! We decided to sit down and have a burger 45 minutes before boarding time, with the gate 2 minutes away. We ordered and were able to sit down, but 45 minutes later was when we finally got our burgers, now at my request, boxed up and to go. It wasn't busy, so I have no idea why it took 45 minutes. After 15-20 minutes, and watching only a few people that were there before us get their food, I started to question the readiness of our order. It didn't do any good. 
Never again!

Ruby's Dinette is the alternative to Ruby's Diner for those who want their airport food on the go.  I assumed this would be a good choice for breakfast since this tends to be the strong point of diners nationwide.  But being located at an airport, sure enough I would be wrong.  I opted for a breakfast burrito which came in at over $9 after tax.  All meals are made to order, so I waited over at the pickup counter for the short order cook to make my meal.  

What I got was a flat brick bedecked with a tub of sour cream.  Brick is an apt description, covering the rectangular cross section and its general heft.  If I were to drop this thing, it would have resounded with a strong thud.  The wrap was bland.  Inside, there was a solid mound of egg and an incredible amount of cheddar cheese.  I also picked up the taste of fresh tomatoes, but it was so hard to tell.  The cheese just dominated the flavor entirely, to the point where I could not even taste the eggs.  It was a regrettable choice, and I had difficulty finishing it.  If you are interested in paying a premium price for really salty, fatty food, then this place is a must visit on your next trip to Las Vegas.  For everyone else, just skip by the neon lights as you will be surely disappointed otherwise.

If you want a quick bite to eat, I wouldn't recommend the bar. At least not today. Probably waited 5 or 6 minutes to order a soda. 
During the day, it's really bright here. There are floor to ceiling windows right next to the bar area. So if you're craving a burger or a shake, you might want to get it to go. They have a walk up counter as well so that might be faster. 
The burgers start at $10 but they have a combo with fries for about eleven and a half. Add a soda, tax and tip and you're almost at  $20. 
Great shakes, good burgers and fries, worth a shot if you're in the mood for a burger. Enjoy!

3.7 Stars

Located in McCarran International Airport.

First impressions,  very well lit, has that old school diner vibe to it, with the red vinyl seats and 60's tunes.

Service was very good and friendly.  Line moved quickly.  They deliver the food to your table and they even cleared my table when i was done eating!

I ordered: 

Ruby Burger and Fries Combo - a good size, juicy burger.  Comes with a half order of fries, but i would consider that a full size order at home.  The fries are similar to McDonald fries.

Overall Experience:
Service - 9/10
Cleanliness - 8/10
Food - 8/10
Value - 7/10
Parking - N/A

Stopped by this place for lunch before my flight. I really wanted some breakfast food but did not realize they stop serving breakfast after 10:00 AM. But...I thought all diners serves breakfast all day. But regardless the point, all of us ordered burgers and it was just whatever. There was nothing great about the expensive burgers nor the milkshake. I looked up the menu on the web while my friends waited in line...but all the stuff I picked out off the menu listed on the website, they didn't have it. which was really odd. I guess I cannot complain since the food choices are limited at the airport.
One of the best club sandwiches I've ever had. Not too expensive (considering it's in an airport). I'd recommend you stop in if you're hungry and have a few minutes to wait.
Great service.  Food is ok for an airport if you don't want 'fast food'.  Nothing to write home about. But better than most.

This wasn't the worst but it certainly wasn't the best either. 
The classic style burger was alright but honestly was far from me saying that if I were in that terminal again that i'd eat there. The fries were so soggy that I gave up after a while. The only reason why this is a 2 star and not a one is because the staff were friendly and the place was clean. Considering it's in an airport it is refreshing to see happy employees and a clean place to eat. Too bad the food was bad.

I thought the meal was a little over priced, but as they say or maybe it's just me... maybe I just say welcome to Vegas! Anyway we got two cheeseburgers, a basket of fries because fries are not included, two waters and a soda for about $45. YIKES 
I don't really think the burger was so dang delicious it was worth the price, but it wasn't good. They never asked how I wanted my burger cooked. I would have requested rare. (I like my burger to moo haha) Oh well though, I still think that if stuck in the airport and hungry for a burger I would choose Ruby's over burger king that's for sure.
The lady that brought us our food and cleaned up after us was so sweet.

The food tasted bad and place is expensive even by airport standards. We ordered two bacon burgers, 1 order of fries, and 3 small drinks. The food cost $40.06. We got 2 smallish burgers that looked like they went straight from the freezer to the microwave. The bun was cold on one the bun on the other was soggy. The basket of fries were cheap quality and limp and soggy. We got pickle spears on the side that looked gross. I expected better quality food for the money we spent.

Ate breakfast.  Was in town for a conference. 
Positives: offers options of seat in vs walk through.  My burrito was very good although good have used more seasoning.  Their bread is the main draw.  The scenery is also pretty if you get a seat look out onto the runway.  

Negatives: service, service, service. They have no iced tea.  We were overcharged and it took several people to explain the issue.   

Yes, I would still return as they were sincere.

My friend and I were about to head our separate ways, but wanted to get a bite to eat first. Ruby's was in the middle of each of our gates.

I ordered the French toast and the breakfast potatoes. I usually love both. The French toast was good, but the middle seemed a little dough-y. Also, I think they cook the French toast on the same grill as they cook everything else. The French toast tasted oddly garlic-y - but I actually liked that. The breakfast potatoes were OK. They were just fried potatoes with some sort of seasoning sprinkled on. But only about half of the potatoes got seasoning - it wasn't very evenly applied. Also, when I think breakfast potatoes, I think sauteed potatoes with peppers and onions. 

The meal ran me $12.

It wasn't the best food I'd ever had, but I was in an airport.
$50 for 3 burgers and a shake. Are you kidding me!!! Shake was not real. Very disappointing when most Ruby's are pretty good.

KEEP WALKING PAST THIS PLACE! If you think your going get food at the airport forget it worst choice ever, long waits, cold and foods expensive...claims to be a fifties diner to justify its $20 burger/fries.  I wasn't the only person standing around confused by the complete cluster fuck service. A guy who sat down 10 minutes after I did, got his food and ate it and left before I got my food...wait time 25-30 minutes?!  The Cold burger and fries sat in the window and were completely disgusting.  They pretty much know your not coming back so you really have no choice as you wait for your food and your flight.  One guy complained waited five minutes and got up and left. I even asked for my money back which they couldn't do...the place reminds me of a slum lord apartment land lord who doesn't care.  ZERO Stars for this shit hole,  place

The club and the burger were OK for airport food.  

The service was poor.  There weren't many people in the sit down side of the restaurant but the servers spent a lot of time visiting.  We had to request everything we needed.

After deciding to eat at the airport, I wanted burgers so we tried Ruby's at terminal 3.  We had  the combo burger and fries and the mushroom cheeseburger.  My burger was very good and the fries were the my favorite thin shoestring fries.  My wife must've been good since she finished it. Next time in Las Vegas, I'll make Ruby's diner as my must go restaurant.

First, it's a diner in an airport, so my expectations weren't high. I was very positively surprised though. I took their bacon cheeseburger - bunless as I eat low carb / keto and a breakfast burrito (where I skipped the tortilla). The burger was excellent with crispy bacon. The burrito was very generous with egg and cheese and I had more lettuce/tomatoe than I needed. We waited about 10min for our food. Soda is free refill which feels generous for an airport restaurant. Overall I was very happy to have found something low carb that tasted just as it should in an airport.

I had lots of time to kill at the airport before a long trip back to the east coast. I was hurting from the night before and absolutely dreading my flight back as I was in the middle seat in front of the restrooms. I knew the only thing that was going to cure my hangover and get me through this undoubtedly horrible flight was a greasy bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. 

I was instantly intrigued with Ruby's decor. It kind of has a 1950's Johnny Rockets vibe. Went up to the counter to order their version of an "Awesome Egg Sandwich." This sandwich was far from Awesome. I really think Ruby's should reconsider the name. "Awful Egg Sandwich" would be more fitting. I received runny scrambled eggs on top of a stale sub roll. They didn't even have the decency to melt the processed american cheese as it was still cold from the fridge. 

If you find yourself in the Las Vegas Airport for breakfast, I suggest you go to the BK Lounge and get yourself a croissan'wich.
Note to self: Do not eat at this place again! Tasteless burger, cold fries. Friendly waitress
It works in a pinch in the Vegas airport, and it always seems to be the place I go before I fly out, but it's nothing to write home about...

Peanut butter shake?!  Mmmmmmmm.  

Having to take a tram to the D gates and seemingly sneak through some weird glass door to get said shake, and then get questioned by security about why I need to get back to my own section of the airport?  Not so mmmmmmm.  Definitely not Ruby's fault, but something to look out for!  

Friendly service, good food, ridiculous airport prices.

What can you say about a place that overlooks the burger so much that you simultaneously wonder what is past "well-done" and "did someone actually drop my burger and replace it with a charcoal briquette"?  You can start with the most nonplussed cashier with an accent that would be forgiven is she didn't also whisper and then roll her eyes when you commit the crime of not understanding her. It is supposed to be a 50's diner, which is ironic since that is half the age of the two shuffling waitresses. If you're going to serve bad food, at least do it quickly.

This has becoming my default place to eat before boarding.   It does get crowded but I can usually find a place to seat.   They will bring the food to the table after ordering.   The food is okay but I think it has the best value among the eateries at Termional 3D.

If you come here knowing what to expect you'll be a bit surprised. Remember it is a airport dining shop. Knowing that i got a adequate cooked cheeseburger with crispy fries and a great root beer float. Big ice cream scoop in a nice root beer. The burger was filling and it helped me pass the time waiting for my flight and provided me a nice filled tummy for my overnight flight. If you keep those tips in mind you'll be satisfied.

Servers spent more time chatting with each other vs. taking my order.  Their egg sandwiches could use a little more time on grill and they should toast or at least heat the english muffin on the sandwich.  Walk on by to your next option.

Located inside the airport. We overcharged for our drinks by about $25. We called and emailed to request a receipt with absolutely no response back. I think the company may be taking advantage of traveling guests since it's almost impossible to reach someone in management! Avoid this place or be sure to save your itemized receipt.
It's a mob of customers and not enough staff. Don't count on catching your plane after a "quick burger" here. Expect to wait 30 minutes for your food. Nice try but a miss on this Ruby's.
Reasonable prices and great service! Always stop here before flying home. Ruby's French Toast!

I know it's an airport chain serving "quick" eats, but the service and food at this Ruby's Diner branch sucks (for the lack of a better term) to the highest degree.

The line moved very fast, which I commend given how busy it gets just before lunch. There are chilled drinks on the shelves next to you in line, while a selection of salads or chips could also be picked up as you make your way to the cash register. While that was all fine and dandy, everything turned sour when I ended up waiting forty five minutes for an incredibly bland and bare bones chicken sandwich with only two people in front of me during lunch...FORTY FIVE MINUTES. 

"Ruby's Chick," the name of the sandwich, has the following: Two buns, a grilled chicken patty, a couple slices of lettuce, and an oh-so beautiful slice of tomato; no sauce, no seasoning, nada. Zero. Zilch. Nanimo. Wala. If I were you, order something else. Better yet, order what is popular. The food will probably be out the window faster.
Good portions, hot food. Pleasantly surprised. Only down side is the menu (at this location anyway) is pretty limited. Surprisingly good for airport fare!
Do not order food at the airport location if you have a flight to catch. They did not tell me when I ordered that my sandwich would take 25 min., and I had to leave. It was paid for.
We were in Ruby's at LAS airport.  Great breakfast sandwiches...like feels like you're not in an airport great!!!  Service was good and the place is clean.
A unsuccessful copy of Johnny Rockets. Food is ok at best...nothing stands out. Your paying for the 50's feel. Bacon chzburger, side fries and bottle water $20. Not worth it

I was heading home from Las Vegas yesterday and had lunch at Ruby's Dinette at the airport.

You order at the counter, are given a number and then you sit down.  Servers (mostly older women) who are dressed in old-school diner outfits deliver your food to you.  I ordered the Rubyburger combo and a chocolate milkshake (it seemed like the kind of place to have one).

It's been a while since I've had a milkshake ... it was good! The burger was good too.

It is located in an airport so you can't expect too much. Even some restaurants that I like can struggle and have sub-par service and food quality in their airport locations. I had never heard of Ruby's Diner anywhere else but thought I would try it. I travel to Las Vegas a lot for work and was tired of trying the same thing. One of the good things about this place is that it has a big menu on the outside that you can look at before you even enter. They have a good selection of food to choose from. I saw that they had a burger that could be substituted with a veggie pattie so I ordered it. The cashier seemed to be new and had to ask for help a couple times with customers that were ahead of me. She also had trouble communicating with the customers. It seemed as if English was her second language and that no doubt contributed to the issue. That gave me time to think of the best way to say my order so that she understood. As I waited I looked around the diner. It was clean and provides a great place to sit and eat your meal away from the crowd of people passing by outside. It was relaxing and you could forget that you were even in an airport. The wait for my order did not take long. The tast of the burger was quite good but I thought the fries were just alright. They had a nice crispiness to them but I thought they were just too skinny. I prefer a little bit more thickness on my fries. It was a bit expensive though but I will try this place again.

We were hungry before our trip back to reality. The BLTA was very good and the wife's club sandwich was good too. The basket of fries was plenty for the both of us. They also had open fountain drinks with refills which was nice considering how much you get nickel and dimed in the airport.

Ruby's Dinette provided a good, fast meal for us as we passed through the airport terminal and hopped in the car. It was surprisingly fresh and served in healthy portions. 

My BLT was a huge sandwich with lots of crispy, greasy bacon and Parmesan crusted bread. I didn't like how unripe the tomato slices were but they were thick and the lettuce green and fresh.

Our breaded zucchini was crispy and not overly greasy. For what we expected this food wasn't bad, the portions were good, and the prices reasonable for the airport.

I arrived early for my flight and I needed a bite to eat. It was just slightly after 10am so I had missed the boat for breakfast. Just when I thought my meal may be ruined, I saw Rubys, a super cute dinner in the D terminal. 

Sadly, I had missed breakfast here as well. I settled on a grilled cheese, paid and sat down. They staff is very efficient here and my grilled wonderfulness arrived quickly. It wasn't your average slapped together grilled cheese. Be prepared for sour dough and the perfect creamy texture of cheese. YUM!

The only downfall?? $8 for a grilled cheese and it only comes with a pickle. Thankfully, it filled me up. But $8 seems super high for what it is. 

Overall, I would go back.

There worst rubies I ever been too. Nasty nasty nothing like  the ones in California. It was more like quantity than quality. I'm so disappointed.  Staff is not that great either.. I never had such a burger and fries so awful. I still regret eatting it. That's how bad it was. Never ever going back to that rubys..

I'm not sure why the overall rating is so low for Ruby's. It is an airport joint, but the two burger and fries we ordered were tasty. They weren't organic, Angus blah blah, but they were juicy and satisfying for airport burgers steps above fast food. 

To place an order: order up front, pay, take a number, display it at your table and your food will be brought to you. Pleasant, bright retro decor.

For airport food, this one is decent. The prices aren't outrages, we were able to get 5 dollar shots w our draft beer purchase. The hickory burger was huge and my husband enjoyed his grilled cheese. Overall enjoyable experience w good service.

Nasty!  The burgers were nasty, the chicken sandwich was nasty, the fries were soggy (nasty), the table was nasty, the condiment bottles were nasty......NASTY.  The cashier was rude and it seemed like we were bothering her by placing an order.  Oh the Oreo milk shake was good maybe  we should have saved the $50 lunch and just ordered milk shakes.  NASTY!  Stay away, Gross!

What an incompetent kitchen. Numerous orders came out uncooked and it seemed numerous people didn't get their food. Our fries were cold and out food took forever. My sandwich was wrong as well. Not to mention hardly anyone speaks English there. Good luck when going there.

This place is great for airport food. The food came out fairly fast. I didn't have much to eat that day, and this meal was mostly going to be my breakfast, lunch, and dinner. And my last time eating something that has a million calories in it for awhile, so I went all out before we left! 

I enjoyed my fried zucchini and my grilled cheese sandwich with bacon. I asked for the bacon and a tomato and avocado, but they didn't put any avocado in the sandwich. It was still good. The tomato was fresh and the sandwich was huge. The portion of zucchini was more than enough for two or three people. 

I had to hurry up and eat it fast, so I only finished half of it. It's not crispy, but it's still good. It came with a little bit of Parmesan cheese on top of it with a side of ranch dressing. I didn't care for the dressing. I'm picky. My husband liked his burger. The serve breakfast food here too. It's fairly clean, and if you sit by the window, you'll get a good view of the planes outside.

If you want to avoid having to put up with screaming kids though, then it'd probably be a good idea to go to a place with a bar as it's less likely that most parents will take their kids to a place that has a bar. Maybe I'm wrong about that, but maybe not. I know it's not the restaurants fault of course. I just wish stupid parents would do more to discipline their kids in public and not just let them run around and cry their heads off. Not cool! I hate people like that!

Avoid this place at all costs!  Although the staff was very nice, it did not make up for the tables being sticky and the filthiness of the restaurant.  Ruby's should NOT charge their customers $8 for a cold, greasy egg and cheese sandwich.

Absolutely no taste whatsoever!! No salt on fries, burgers we're gross and overpriced. They sell themselves on burgers, yeah right!! Whatta joke!!! Oh and by the way, don't put the Evian bottled water on the tables on the tables without thinking someone left it or it's free. Kinda weird.

Sometimes when you have extra time at the airport before your flight you look for spots to grab a quick bite before jumping on your plane. Ruby's Dinette visually has that retro soda shop cool look to it. All red and white, counter seating with swiveling stools, counter staff all dressed in white. Even the signage and menu has old time graphics, The concept is well thought out, but the actual end result is just basically mediocre airport food. 

Barely passable burgers and sandwiches populate the menu. It's really just another fast food chain-like operation masquerading as a specialty restaurant but ultimately falls short of it's goal. A bit pricey for the quality too. The times I have been here I can attest to always regretting eating here.

As is the problem I find with McCarran Airport there are too many of these substandard places to eat, and not really any quality places to sit down and enjoy a satisfying meal while waiting for a flight. 

Let's be real, the negative reviews are not because of depressed people leaving Las Vegas, but it's because of the depressing food offered here!

Bleh bleh bleh bleh bleh!

I was in the D gate and starving, and this seemed closest to what I wanted. I figured, "hey, it's ok Adrian, this cheese burger is 10 bucks but I bet it's super bomb and they probably give you fries with it or something."

How very, truly wrong I was. 10 bucks bought me the grossest, COLDEST cheese burger I've ever had, with a very pathetic pickle. It was honestly the worst burger I've ever tasted. I wish I could go back in time to when I was ordering the food. "What can I get you?" they'd say. 
"NOTHING!" I would scream. "Because I hate you."
This place is not fancy, but the burger was delicious! Plus you don't have to pay any tips here. You can just sit and enjoy awesome burger waiting for your flight.

I stopped in for lunch on my home from Vegas and had a Gin & Ginger....didn't order a double or anything, just the standard Gin & Ginger cocktail...cost $17.50. My friend order a crown and 7up, that cost 16.00. I dined at The Charcoal Room at Sante Fe Station had a bone in New York Strip, Caesar salad and a side of potatoes, two beers and a Gin Martini and my bill was $78.00. My bill at Rubys for a burger and fry combo and 2 of the drinks mention above and my bill was $84.00. I would consider dining down at Wolfgang Pucks before going here again.

Very good burgers, and even better onion rings. We were all hungry by the time we got to the airport. My sis asked one of the ladies working by the slots where the best eats were, and the lady said our terminal had a bunch of yummy choices. She mentioned that Ruby's has the best shakes, but we didn't feel like getting stomach aches on the plane, so we passed on that. The fries were okay, especially after eating the wonderful ones at Bouchon in the Venetian. Total for 4 was about $50, which isn't bad for airport food.

I always eat breakfast here on the way home from Vegas. Everything on the menu is good, but my favorite is the Awesome Egg Sandwich, which contains bacon, scrambled eggs and American cheese on a sourdough bun. The coffee is always hot and fresh, and the service is extremely prompt and courteous. Prices are fair too. Highly recommended!
Sat down for table service before 10am. Took long enough for a server to come by that it was past 10 when I got to order. Wouldn't serve breakfast, even 5 minutes past.

I enjoyed Ruby's !I left earlier than I should have for my flight and I was so hungry.So for  lunch I decided to try .The burger and fries was a  great choice,and was a welcomed changed from all the other "usual" airport options.I'd recommend it,and would definitely eat there again.

Updated: stopped in again and for the first time tried a club sandwich.  It was great!   The onion rings still rock and the service here today was much improved over my last visit.  I notched them up to 4 stars from 3 stars overall.  


I have eaten at many Ruby's diners before and rather than choke down a pretzel dog or parhaps some other fast food we decided to sit and have a burger.  

This location has a "dine in" area where you are waited on and then a counter area where you order, find a seat and then they bring the food out to you.  We chose the dine in area except nobody was st the getting desk.  After about 6 minutes and watching several others get frustrated and just go grab a table, we did the same.  They should have someone up there or a sign, even just a post it note that says "please seat yourself" but no such luck. 

The food.  The burgers and onion rings are typically always decent here and this visit was no different.  These are not gourmet burgers but are a definite step above most all "fast food drive through" burgers.  I would give the food 3.5 to 4 stars for a burger joint. 

The service was ok but the guy would waited on us was just a little.....hmmm...different.  So, between that and the lack of someone up at the entrance I would go with 2.5 to 3 stars.  

The ambiance is that of an airport diner.  No need to elaborate on that.  

Overall this is decent food with fast food type service.  It will fill your stomach but probably not much else, lol.  

Enjoy !

My wife and I got a burger here in a pinch.  It was very good, and came out fresh and quick.  It's an airport restaurant, so price isn't an issue worth commenting on.  

Considering the setting, you can certainly make worse dining choices.

We fly United frequently which leaves from Terminal D.  Initially we were in the adjacent Starbucks line thinking we will get an artisan breakfast sandwich until we noticed no oven. No oven, no sandwiches.  

We popped over to Ruby's which we've eaten at over the years, but never breakfast. 

I'm still thinking breakfast sandwiches on my mind.  Lo and behold, Ruby offers two.  I get the scrambled egg, bacon, cheese on an English muffin with a cup of coffee.

Ordered, paid, given a number, found a table and waited for the food.

Breakfast sandwich was good, the coffee not so good.   Better to buy coffee from adjacent Starbucks.

Killer breakfast sandwiches. 

Seriously, they can cure a horrible Vegas-produced hangover like nothing else. 

The potatos are underseasoned, avoid. Coffee is standard diner quality- but it is bottomless.  

A bit pricey but remember two things:

1) you're in an airport
2) you can pay with all your casino winnings - at least that's what I did

7's and 11's baby!

Really it's a 0 star diner. My burger wasn't good bun was cold and I guess combo to them does not include a drink. They do not serve in order of orders where taken. Lady said they serve in random order. Huh??!!! Ridiculous this place is a joke and over priced.

It's a diner in an airport. I was hungry, but a touch hungover. All I wanted was something small in hopes of settling my stomach so that I didn't get too nauseous during take off because who wants to be THAT idiot leaving Vegas who pukes on the plane ride home? No one, Arya Stark style, that's who. Anyway, so I ordered some fries and a soda. The fries were way overcooked and stale. The staff was not friendly at all, no smile, no hello, just a "what do you want? give me money, go sit down and wait" attitude. Boo. Not cool, folks. Crappy food AND crappy service? Lame sauce. It's best to have great food and great service, but at the very least have ONE. You lacked in both. Epic fail, like the way Joffrey tried to rule Westeros.
Overpriced, bland breakfast. Staff doesn't know the difference between "green onions" and green bell peppers. Not impressive at all. Good music though.
If I could give this place zero stars I would. Our fries were very obviously old and tasteless so was our food. It was extremely overpriced as well.

So leaving Las Vegas there's very few places in the airport to actually eat so we picked this place I will say it was decent very overpriced but the portions were big it was almost $15 for a hamburger and french fries and that is with no drink

This is a pretty decent place for a quick meal at the airport. It is located at the d gate main entrance area where people can see after they get off the tram. I really liked their French roast turkey sandwich. I like how the cranberry sauce really made a difference. Last time I was in Vegas in the morning, their lunch menu was not open yet so I ordered the muffin from the breakfast menu. It was ok. I didn't like the scramble egg that much and the muffins were in no way close to local business's breakfast muffins.

At Ruby's for breakfast, there was no seating in the main dining area, so my husband got in line to order and I found a table near the bar.  Just so happens that that area has servers, so I couldn't sit there as my husband was bringing food and I was told the servers would "lose out".  I moved our stuff to a general seating area while my husband is being told he can't take food out to where I was.  He gets out of line, finds me and gets back in line to order food.  This is so ridiculous.  Decide if you're a bar or a restaurant, servers or no servers.  Just told I can't have the grilled cheese I wanted because that is only for lunch.  What a pain.

Really nice pit-stop to grab something to eat on your way to the terminal , burgers are fresh and hot. 
The employees are super cool and friendly.

I enjoyed this place!  They sub the beef for turkey at no additional charge and its actually delicious.   The only thing is that the fries weren't seasoned at all and left more to be desired :/ They take military discounts and thats always a great thing in my book!  I'm not sure what their ruby sauce is but spoiler alert its a white creamy sauce that reminds me of a less tart mayonnaise  perhaps a tastier version of miracle whip
