My food was good. Ordered a veggie burger and fries. Service was terrible for me. Now a veggie patty doesn't have to cook as long a beef patty so I couldn't understand why it took 25 minutes for my food or how how at least 5 different groups of people who ordered after me received there food almost 5 minutes after sitting at a table. I'm not over exaggerating but when you are waiting for your food for awhile, you start to notice your environment more; whose leaving, whose coming, who came and left while I was still sitting. Hmmm, so the moment I go to check on my food is the same moment when it finally gets brought to the table. I was very dissatisfied with the service here!

Had the Ruby's egg, cheese and bacon muffin. It was good. What really striked me was the friendly lady who brought food to the table! Super nice and friendly. Usually I don't get that at the airports. She is asian and has grey and black hair. She greeted when she gave me the food and then thanked me as I left as well. :) Just makes you feel better before going on your flight.

Coming from New Jersey, when I think of diners, I think many menu choices, greasy food made to order, and all items available all day .  Ruby's diner at the McCaren airport is none of these.  The eggs came from a box and were cold on our sandwiches, the home fries frozen, the rolls were flavorless and seemed a little stale, and the coffee weak and tasteless.  The menu was very limited to begin with and the only things available to order at the time we were there was one of four choices.  The best part of the stop was the super friendly cashier that took our order.  In fact all the service was excellent.  

I understand that this is airport food, but when paying 33 dollars for two breakfast sandwiches and coffee, I would expect a little better food.

Good - view, seating, cashier, clean. The breakfast sandwich and chocolate milk shake. 

Bad- where do I start. The person dropping off the food was rude, brash and should maybe learn some customer service skills. She's basically dropping food off at tables, acting like she's serving an extended prison sentence. Good example when dropping off our food, I asked if we could have something for the onion rings, she glared at me with (wtf) you want stare lol, ok never mind  I'll eat plain onion rings. For the burger I ordered, was tasteless ( I remember all the food being good last time don't know what happened), 

We'll likely try this place again but hoping the server completes her prison sentence and moves on to a more rewarding experience.

Everything is Ala Carte, prices are astronomical and the weight staff leaves something to be desired 
Two people $35 easy
And you have to beg to get something other than a Diet Coke since " that's all that's in the bar gun" 
The food isn't that great either, even for airport food

Bleh...The epitome of icky airport food.

  I've been to Ruby's many a time back in SoCal. I figured of my choices at the D gate, Ruby's was my best shot at cheap but decent. Wrong!... I ordered a grilled cheese w/ tomato.... They forgot the tomato :( The bread was cold and soggy and didn't seem very grilled. I also ordered fried zucchini which were good but DAMN... cool those things off before you serve them. I annihilated my mouth with one of those... They were way to hot. My opinion on this place is: Walk on By. Pay exorbitant prices for crummy food somewhere else...

I don't normally write reviews but this incident truly stood out to me. I ordered my food to stay, got a number and waited at my table.  After seeing food arrive for people who sat down 15 mins after I did, tried to flag down the waitress to check my order.  She waved me off and said, it depends on your order... Basically dismissing me.  Five minutes later, I asked again, I mean... It's the airport, luckily I arrived with plenty of time to spare but I didn't want to miss my flight waiting for breakfast!  Waitress finally agreed to check my order... After another few minutes, came back and asked for my receipt because the kitchen doesn't believe that they missed an order!  What the?!  So I've been sitting here for 20 minutes with a fake number trying to get a free meal??  I'm at the airport, I clearly can afford the plane ride, but hey maybe I wanted to trick Ruby's into giving me a free egg sandwich... I guess you never know!! What a way to treat your customers!!Luckily I had to expense my meal and kept my receipt. After providing proof I had paid I was finally brought my sandwich, no apologies, just a sob story of how she had to fight with that kitchen staff. Food was mediocre at best, I guess I should just be thankful I got it?

Bottom line, if you're in a rush for your flight... Avoid this place!!

Quick review: I expect certain things based on a restaurant's name. "diner" means something. I am here to tell you in this case it means nothing at all. To wit: THEY STOP ALL BREAKFAST SERVICE AT 10:00 AM.  And this in Las Vegas. No matter how hungry you are, you can find something better than this so-called "diner."

Airport food in general has drastically improved with lots of good restaurants and maybe vegas it's the same, but if you're taking a red eye flight some of the places are closed. I stopped in Ruby's for a snack and a beer and it's a comfortable place and I liked it. I ordered chili fries and they were disappointing. I think they were just cold or something but the cheese wasn't even melted and if you picked up a fry it just fell off. I wouldn't order again but I will return to the diner next month and try something else. Maybe it was just an off night, or this isn't the best menu item who knows.
The dinette is cute.  50's flair. Long lines so it seems like a popular airport eatery. I had the BLTA and fries.  Cleaned my plate!!
Dear Las Vegas Airport Authority: Rubys is your best foot forward? Bar tender warned me at least about the cook. Save your money and avoid.

I was really looking forward to a burger after a a long rough weekend in Vegas. I remember eating at Ruby's when I lived in San Diego so I was excited. 

Ill say that maybe i've had alot of good burgers in the mean time I guess but i wasn't all that impressed with the burger. Maybe its because they have to crank out a ton at the airport so they skimp on quality, but I remember them being much better. 

I will say that the onion rings were gigantic and will most likely kill you, but they looked delicious. 

If you're in a pinch at the airport give Ruby's a try, because burger king is about your only other burger option.

I was expecting better from this diner. However, it was just ridiculously overpriced for a hamburger and fries. When I got my order after a long wait, the fries were stale. The burger was decent but it was not worth the long wait. This place was pretty crowded. The tables were not wiped down either which was disconcerting. I think other Ruby's diners are much better than the one at this airport. There isn't much dining area here. It would be easier if you got your order to go but then that would take a while for them to cook your burger.

Very good food at reasonable prices. The breakfast sandwiches were a decent size and fresh. They actually make good, not just heat it up. The coffee was sub par but tolerable. If you need some food before your flight check this place out.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! Growing up in SoCal, I used to visit Ruby's regularly with friends and family. Since moving in Las Vegas, sadly I can no longer get my Ruby burger fix unless I am flying through D gate at McCarran Airport. 

As a few fellow yelpers have stated earlier, when it comes to Sunday (or any day for that matter) hang over food, nothing beats a Ruby's breakfast sandwich. Heck.... get the chili cheese fries to because they are epic!

Granted there is only one drawback to this little dinette.... the price. But then again.... ladies and gentleman of the traveling public, it's an airport, your a captured audience, so prepared to spend a little more then you should for that meal, it's just the way it's got to be. 

But seriously though, this place has the best burgers in D gate, if not the whole airport! :)

I hardly expect anything good from restaurants in an airport, let alone a diner in an airport. But they did everything they could to make me hate my experience there. 
For starters, we ordered drinks. The waitress never brought our drinks to us.  We had to ask the bartender for them, which they weren't even made yet.  We didn't even get any water brought over to us. We had to ask for them too.  My wife ordered the pomegranate mojito which looked okay. I tried to order the American Mule, but they said they didn't have any ginger beer and haven't had any since she's been there.  The waitress questioned why it was still on the menu. I then ordered the Southbound flight drink.  They didn't have cilantro for the drink, so they improvised.  It was nasty and had sent it back.  I then just settled for a vodka/ cranberry.
Next was the food. She ordered the BLTA (Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato, Avocado) sandwich.  It was okay. I ordered the clam chowder with onion rings.  The waitress gave me the option to have in a bread bowl or regular bowl. I said bread bowl, but they didn't have it. And she didn't tell me until she delivered my food.  My clam chowder tasted like it came out of a can.  It was bland, and not worth $9 for the bowl.  
It also seemed like the waitress knew that we weren't happy with our order.  She would look at our direction and even walk past us and not ask whether we were enjoying our meal or not. They weren't busy and there were many empty tables, so I know it wasn't that.  Needless to say, we will be looking elsewhere next time we are in this airport.

When you pay $11.19 for a burger that you wouldn't pay $1.19 for from a gas station & your waiter tells you " hey it's Airport food" kind of pisses you off. Especially when you have 1st hand knowledge that airport food can be outstanding (DIA) 
Bun was dry, burger over cooked or held under heat lamp for last couple hours. Special sauce was a dribble of Mayo. 
Come on McCarran step up your food offerings. World class you are not.....
